## Suggested Readings

This week's lectures are adapted from [Chapter 6](https://statsthinking21.github.io/statsthinking21-core-site/probability.html) and [Chapter 7](https://statsthinking21.github.io/statsthinking21-core-site/sampling.html) of [*Statistical Thinking*](https://statsthinking21.github.io/statsthinking21-core-site/index.html) by Russell Poldrack.

Additional resources for further exploration:

 - **[Probability Lecture Notes](https://stat20.berkeley.edu/fall-2024/3-generalization/01-prob-foundations/notes.html) from the Stat20 course at Berkeley.**

 - *A Student's Guide to Bayesian Statistics* by Ben Lambert
 - *The Drunkard's Walk: How Randomness Rules Our Lives* by Leonard Mlodinow
 - *Ten Great Ideas about Chance* by Persi Diaconis and Brian Skyrms

::: {.notes}
These books provide excellent additional resources for understanding probability theory and its applications.
